result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber A. Tyler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Follow assessment recommendations.
Follow rules and pay fees of supervision.  
Submit DNA sample if not previously submitted.
Absolute Sobriety.
No association with drug dealers or anybody on probation.
Do not enter any bars.

timeConds.notes:
Imposed with HUBER and No Good Time. Authorized transfer to Outagamie County.  If in compliance with jail regulations. 
Within 72 hrs, report to Winnebago County Work Release Center (M-F/7:30am-3pm) with completed GPS application and the minute sheet in order to set a report date which shall be no later than 60 days from the date of sentencing.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.
Imposed and Stayed as a Condition of Probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Amber A. Tyler in court with attorney Travis T Schreurs.  Eric D Sparr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Bond continues.  Arraignment scheduled for June 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.
